Pre-Game Insights: The Memphis Grizzlies look for a third consecutive victory on Sunday when visiting the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Memphis is 22-10 and first in the Southwest Division, a half-game ahead of the Houston Rockets.
Memphis defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 132-124 on Friday night.
Memphis has won two straight and four of the last five.
Ja Morant left Friday's game with a shoulder injury and is doubtful for Sunday.
Jaren Jackson Jr is leading Memphis in scoring, averaging 21.5 points per game.
Desmond Bane is the second-leading scorer for Memphis, averaging 15.3 points per game and is the active leader in assists, averaging 4.7 per game.
Zach Edey is the leading rebounder for Memphis, averaging 7.9 per game.
Memphis scores an average of 123.7 points per game.
Oklahoma City Thunder complete a back-to-back on Sunday when hosting the Memphis Grizzlies after playing on the road Saturday versus the Charlotte Hornets.
Oklahoma City is 24-5 and leads the Northwest division by 8 games over the Denver Nuggets.
The Thunder defeated the Indiana Pacers 120-114 on Thursday night with Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tying his career high of 45 points.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is scoring an average of 31.1 points per game and handing out an average of 6.1 assists per game to lead Oklahoma City in both.
Jalen Williams averages 5.9 rebounds per game to lead the Thunder.
Oklahoma City has four players averaging double figures in scoring.
The Thunder score an average of 115.2 points per game.
Oklahoma City has covered the number in eight of its last 10 games.
Memphis is likely to be without star point guard Ja Morant, who injured his shoulder on Friday.
